subject: Communication
title: Sunk Cost and Commitment Traps
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Sunk Cost and Commitment Traps.

hook.text: You've watched 90 minutes of a terrible movie. You stay because you already 'invested' the time.

buildup.text: The sunk cost fallacy: we continue behaviors because of past investment, not future benefit.

discovery.text: Manipulators exploit this by getting you invested early â€” time, money, or emotion â€” then escalating demands.

twist.text: Casinos, abusive relationships, and bad business deals all trap people through accumulated sunk costs.

climax.text: The rational move is always to evaluate future costs and benefits â€” ignoring what you've already spent.

punchline.text: What you've spent is gone. Only what's ahead matters.

quiz.question: What is the sunk cost fallacy?
options: Continuing because of past investment, not future benefit
